TODO: Make an appointment with your OBGYN to verify that you’re pregnant and to make sure that the pregnancy appears normal.
Deadline Type: MONTH

TODO: Take a look at your insurance plan to understand what prenatal care is covered.
Deadline Type: MONTH

TODO: Start keeping a baby diary! You’re definitely going to have a variety of emotions
Deadline Type: and you may want to write some of them down. It will be fun to look back on this later.

TODO: Adjust your diet. You’ll need nutrients for two now
Deadline Type: so you should eat plenty of fruits and vegetables. Make sure to drink plenty of water

TODO: Quit smoking and drinking alcohol. We know it’s not as fun but it’s definitely best for your baby.
Deadline Type: MONTH

TODO: Exercise regularly. You don’t need to do anything strenuous
Deadline Type: but make sure you’re getting light exercise at least three times per week.

TODO: Take folic acid supplements. They have been proven to greatly reduce the risk of some birth defects.
Deadline Type: MONTH

TODO: Rest! Remember that you’ll be exhausted in the early stages of your pregnancy
Deadline Type: so make sure to get plenty of sleep whenever you can. It’s OK if you aren’t as productive as you used to be!

TODO: If you’re dealing with morning sickness
Deadline Type: use ginger to settle your stomach and eat small

TODO: Schedule your prenatal tests. This is a crucial part of your pregnancy checklist! Doctors are busy
Deadline Type: so it’s best to make your appointments in advance. Talk to your doctor to find out what prenatal test schedule they recommend.

TODO: Start budgeting for the baby. Having a baby isn’t cheap
Deadline Type: so begin planning your finances right away.

TODO: Spend time with your partner! This is important
Deadline Type: but it’s something that’s easy to overlook. Make sure you’re getting enough one-on-one time with your partner. Once your baby arrives
Deadline: it might be hard to find time to be intimate with your loved one.

TODO: Decide where and how you’d like to give birth. You may want to deliver in a hospital with an OBGYN. Or you may want to have your baby in the comfort of your own home with the help of a midwife and doula. We recommend doing some research before deciding which option is right for you.
Deadline Type: MONTH

TODO: Decide whether or not you’d like to learn the sex of the baby. Some couples like to know
Deadline Type: while others want to wait until the baby is born to find out. Talk with your partner and decide what’s best for you.

TODO: Research the maternity leave policy at your workplace. You might not be using this for some time
Deadline Type: but ticking it off the to-do list early gives you one less thing to worry about.

TODO: Make an appointment with a dentist. Pregnant women are more susceptible to inflamed gums and gingivitis
Deadline Type: so it’s important to get a cleaning and checkup with your dentist.

TODO: Look into childbirth classes
Deadline Type: such as the Lamaze Technique
column7: to name a few. These classes can help a great deal when you go into labor. But schedule them early
column8: as they tend to fill up quickly.

TODO: Buy comfortable bras that fit your changing
Deadline Type: tender breasts. Even though your belly isn’t big enough to need maternity clothes
Deadline: your breasts might have grown enough to go up a bra size!

TODO: Announce the good news! Your friends and family will be overjoyed to know that you have a baby on the way. Now is also a good time to let your colleagues and managers know that you’re pregnant.
Deadline Type: MONTH

TODO: Start shopping for maternity clothes. After the fourth month
Deadline Type: your bump will start to grow considerably
Deadline: so make sure you’ve got all the right attire.

TODO: Stock up on the skincare products you need! Try Mustela Soothing Moisturizing Balm
Deadline Type: specially formulated to relieve itching sensations caused by pregnancy. And use our Stretch Marks Cream or Oil to ensure smooth
Deadline: glamorous skin before and after giving birth.

TODO: Go on your babymoon! A babymoon is a pre-baby vacation for you and your partner. It’s a great way to spend time together before the later stages of your pregnancy make travel difficult. If you hit the beach
Deadline Type: bring lots of sunscreen and learn about sunbathing with a bun in the oven.

TODO: Continue taking care of your body. This includes eating healthy
Deadline Type: drinking water

TODO: Decide where your baby will sleep. Perhaps you’d like to have your newborn sleep in your room
Deadline Type: or maybe you’d like to set up a nursery. Either way

TODO: If you have chosen to find out the sex of your baby
Deadline Type: decide if and how you want to tell your friends and family! A gender reveal party is a fun way to share the news and spend time with your loved ones.

TODO: Have your anomaly scan and ultrasound exam performed. These are important prenatal tests
Deadline Type: as they ensure the health of your unborn baby.

TODO: Keep meeting with the person who will be delivering your baby. Developing this relationship will help you feel more comfortable in the delivery room.
Deadline Type: MONTH

TODO: Decide whether you will breastfeed or formula feed. If you’re planning on nursing
Deadline Type: learn about different breastfeeding positions and what to expect. Be proactive and start using Nursing Comfort Balm now.

TODO: Start planning your baby shower! This is an exciting part of any pregnancy. Get a group of close friends and family together to plan the perfect baby shower in your honor.
Deadline Type: MONTH

TODO: Research childcare options. The next few months are going to fly by
Deadline Type: so looking into childcare options now will help you take care of other tasks later. You want to be as prepared as possible for your little bundle of joy.

TODO: Begin thinking about your baby’s name! You’ve probably been doing this since day one
Deadline Type: but now’s the time to start talking with your partner about possible names.

TODO: Plan maternity leave with your employer. This is an important part of the pregnancy checklist. Setting up your maternity leave well in advance ensures a smooth transition away from
Deadline Type: and back to

TODO: Write a birth plan. This simply means thinking through your preferences and expectations for delivery day
Deadline Type: then putting it all down on paper so everyone (doctors
column7: etc.) is on the same page.

TODO: Ask friends and family for baby hand-me-downs. You might be able to borrow baby clothes
Deadline Type: furniture
Deadline: and strollers from friends and family members with older children.

TODO: Create a baby registry for your baby shower to let friends and family know which items would be the most helpful as you prepare for your baby’s arrival.
Deadline Type: MONTH

TODO: Connect with other soon-to-be-moms. This will give you the chance to share experiences
Deadline Type: get advice about childbearing

TODO: Find a good pediatrician. This will save you the hassle of scheduling various appointments with different pediatricians after your little one has arrived.
Deadline Type: MONTH

TODO: Enjoy your baby shower! This should be a special time for you to connect with your loved ones and celebrate.
Deadline Type: MONTH

TODO: Finish setting up the nursery or the place where your baby will sleep. Your new little one will be here before you know it!
Deadline Type: MONTH

TODO: Pre-cook meals that you can keep in the freezer. This will help for those nights when you’re too tired or too busy to cook a nice meal at home.
Deadline Type: MONTH

TODO: Wash your baby’s clothes and sheets. The fabrics will be more comfortable for your baby as a result
Deadline Type: and it’s much easier to get this task out of the way now.

TODO: Stock up on the baby products you’ll inevitably need like baby oils
Deadline Type: moisturizers

TODO: Name your baby! You may have already chosen a name
Deadline Type: but now’s the time to speak with your partner and finalize your decision.

TODO: Pack your hospital bag. Things like a change of clothes
Deadline Type: toiletries
column6: and cell phone chargers should all get packed in the hospital bag.

TODO: Pre-register with the hospital. This will make checking in to the hospital much easier when the big day comes since all of the paperwork will already be taken care of.
Deadline Type: MONTH

TODO: Make plans for your other children and pets. You could go into labor at any moment now
Deadline Type: so knowing who will take care of your other children and your pets while you’re in the hospital is critical.

TODO: Install a baby seat in your car. Later on
Deadline Type: you’ll thank yourself for doing this early on.

TODO: Relax and wait for the big day! This is probably the most important thing you can do. Enjoy the final moments of your pregnancy
Deadline Type: and imagine how much love you’re going to shower your little one with.
